meanings.definition: To surpass in points or score.
meanings.sent1: In the game, our team always outpoints the opponents.
meanings.sent2: She outpoints her classmates in math tests consistently.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outpoints the birds in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: His dedication outpoints his natural talent in achieving success.
meanings.sent5: The sun outpoints all the stars in brightness.

meanings.definition: To exceed in importance or significance.
meanings.sent1: Her kindness outpoints her intelligence in making friends.
meanings.sent2: The safety of the passengers outpoints everything else for the pilot.
meanings.sent3: The cat's laziness outpoints its curiosity when it comes to exploring new places.
meanings.sent4: The impact of his words outpoints the volume of his voice.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset outpoints the busyness of the city.
